result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Henry J. Gibbemeyer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Theses conditions will become conditions of Extended Supervision except for the conditional jail time

--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for 36 months. Install Ignition Interlock device in accordance with WisStat 343.301(2m). The deadline for installing ignition interlock, regardless of license status, is 2/15/15, or when the Defendant applies or receives a license under Chapter 343, whichever is earlier. Prisoner is not subject to ignition interlock under WisStat 303.08(10r).

--AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel,

--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

Case called at 10:33 am
Defendant Henry J. Gibbemeyer in court with Attorney Jacquelyn L. Wolter. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

Court sentences Mr. Gibbemeyer to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any sentence in being, Court STAYS this sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with conditions (Theses conditions will become conditions of Extended Supervision except for the conditional jail time)

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 days credit for time already served.

Conditions:
--serve 210 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for all purposes to include attendance at AA meetings and treatment; to commence FORTHWITH, last 90 days of 210 day sentence will be served on SCRAM X 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Participate in the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--Absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescribed drugs as prescribed)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other assessment/treatment /therapy required by agent
--No drive without a valid drivers license and agent approval
-- to pay fine of $1500 plus costs = $2908 plus blood testing costs of $56.74 to the Fort Atkinson PD
--To provide DNA sample

Conditions NOT of Probations:
--Revocation of Operating Privileges 36 months
-- 6 demerit points
--AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel,
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for 36 months. Install Ignition Interlock device in accordance with WisStat 343.301(2m). The deadline for installing ignition interlock, regardless of license status, is 2/15/15, or when the Defendant applies or receives a license under Chapter 343, whichever is earlier. Prisoner is not subject to ignition interlock under WisStat 303.08(10r).

Cash bond to be applied.
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given  
recess: 10:58 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

case called at 11:23am.
Defendant Henry J. Gibbemeyer in court with Attorney Jacquelyn L. Wolter.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Plea/Sentencing Hearing today, however ADA Hall explains that Mr. Gibbemeyer is being considered as a possible candidate for the Alcohol Court programming.  Counsel join in requesting adjournment of the hearing for appoximately three weeks. 
Mr. Gibbemeyer verifies that the N. Main Sreet, Fort Atkinson address remains current. 
recess 11:24am

NET:  reschedule Plea/Sentencing hearing in approximately three weeks

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:04am. 
Defendant Henry J. Gibbemeyer in court with Attorney Jacquelyn L. Wolter.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Wolter indicates that she does not anticipate any motions on the stop or the arrest.   Attorney Wolter submits documentation (marked as Exhibit #1) that shows that she asked for transcripts from Portage County cases in April and that the subject court reporter has now said that she will have the transcripts completed yet this week. Attorney Wolter has needed to await the transcript preparation in order to determine if there is a valid collateral attack issue.
Counsel inform the Court that this case may be a possible referral into the Adult Alcohol Court.
Mr. Gibbermeyer verifies that the 722 N. Main Street address remains current. 
recess 10:07am.

Case called at 1:17 pm
Defendant Henry J. Gibbemeyer in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores. 
-Not to drive
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on either the first Monday or Thursday, whichever is the next SCRAM installation date immediately following release from custody, at 1:30 pm.

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.

Recess: 1:36 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: April 7, 2014 at 9:00 am
